svg.text: 1. CORE CONCEPT: Discrete Diffusion for Text
Key Insight: Unlike continuous diffusion (images), text requires DISCRETE diffusion with tokens
x₀ (clean data) ────────────→ xₜ (partially masked) ────────────→ x_T (fully masked)
βₜ = probability of masking at step t
Input: Masked sequence xₜ + time t
Output: p_θ(x₀ⁱ | xₜ) for each position i
Similar to BERT but with time embedding
• O(T) steps vs O(n) for AR
• Continuous time embedding via sinusoidal encoding
• Competitive with AR models on benchmarks
Diffusion LLMs bridge the gap between discrete text and continuous diffusion by using
absorbing-state Markov chains with [MASK] tokens, enabling efficient parallel text generation.
